summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report documenting the FBI's interview of pilot David Rogers aboard Jeffrey Epstein's private jet at Teterboro Airport on July 6, 2019. Rogers, Epstein's longtime pilot, stated he had no relevant information about Epstein and requested to consult an attorney before speaking further. He was served with a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: David Rogers
persons.context: Interviewed by FBI agents aboard Epstein's private jet at Teterboro Airport; stated he had no information relevant to the investigation of Epstein and requested to consult an attorney before speaking further.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual under investigation; David Rogers is identified as his pilot.

connections.description: Rogers is identified as a pilot for Epstein and has been for many years.

events.title: FBI Interview of David Rogers
events.description: FBI agents interviewed pilot David Rogers aboard Jeffrey Epstein's private jet at Teterboro Airport, New Jersey. Rogers stated he had no relevant information about Epstein and requested to consult an attorney. He was served with a grand jury subpoena.

locations: Teterboro Airport, Teterboro, New Jersey, United States
keyFacts: David Rogers, Jeffrey Epstein's longtime pilot, was interviewed by the FBI on July 6, 2019.
The interview took place aboard Epstein's private jet at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey.
Rogers stated he had no information relevant to the investigation of Epstein.
Rogers requested to consult an attorney before speaking further with the FBI.
Rogers was served with a grand jury subpoena by the FBI agents.
